intro: Althenia cylindrocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit althenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical fruits that mature to a reddish color. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Althenia cylindrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
